greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) = binomial(2^k + n-1, k).
comment: Let vector R_{n} equal row n of this array; then R_{n+1} = P * R_{n} for n>=0, where triangle P = A132625 such that row n+1 of P = row n of P^(2^n) with appended '1' for n>=0.
link: G. C. Greubel, Antidiagonal rows n = 0..50, flattened
formula: G.f. for row n: Sum_{i>=0} (1 + 2^i*x)^(n-1) * log(1 + 2^i*x)^i / i!.
t(n, k) = T(n-k, k) = binomial(2^k + n - k -1, k).
example: Form column vector R_{n} out of row n of this array;
then row n+1 can be generated from row n by:
where triangular matrix P = A132625 begins:
where row n+1 of P = row n of P^(2^n) with appended '1' for n>=0.
program: (PARI) /* Coefficient of x^k in g.f. of row n: */ T(n,k)=polcoeff(sum(i=0,k,(1+2^i*x+x*O(x^k))^(n-1)*log((1+2^i*x)+x*O(x^k))^i/i!),k)
(Sage) flatten([[binomial(2^k +n-k-1, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 14 2021
(Magma) [Binomial(2^k +n-k-1, k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 14 2021
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 07 2008
